main event: A oblong, disc-shaped object, the size of a basketball, with a reddish-orange color, was observed east of Montezuma, Indiana on September 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object disappeared in the northeast direction.
The object reappeared in the east heading west, holding that course for approximately five miles before turning northward.
The object then turned eastward and traveled out of sight.
The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes.
The report lists several possible explanations for the sighting, including aircraft, balloon, astronomical, or insufficient data for evaluation, with the final conclusion being 'Unidentified'.
sighted object: Oblong, disc-shaped object, size of a basketball, reddish-orange color
photographs: No photographs included in the report
